canonical_explanation.text: A factor of a number divides it exactly (no remainder). A multiple of a number is obtained by multiplying it by a whole number. Prime numbers have exactly two factors: 1 and themselves. Composite numbers have more than two factors. The number 1 is neither prime nor composite.
rules: Factors always come in pairs: if a divides n, then n/a also divides n
Every number is a factor of itself; 1 is a factor of every number
Divisibility by 2: last digit is even (0,2,4,6,8)
Divisibility by 3: sum of digits is divisible by 3
Divisibility by 5: last digit is 0 or 5

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a factor of 24?
questions.explanation_correct: 24 ÷ 6 = 4 with no remainder. So 6 is a factor of 24.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A factor divides the number exactly. 24÷6=4 (no remainder), so 6 is a factor.

questions.question_text: List all factors of 18.
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 18: 1x18, 2x9, 3x6. So factors are 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Find factor pairs: 1x18, 2x9, 3x6. All factors: 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18.

questions.question_text: How many factors does 36 have? ___
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 36: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12, 18, 36. That is 9 factors.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Factor pairs: 1x36, 2x18, 3x12, 4x9, 6x6. So 9 factors.

questions.question_text: Which is a multiple of 7?
questions.explanation_correct: 35 = 7 x 5. So 35 is a multiple of 7.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 7 x 5 = 35. So 35 is a multiple of 7.

questions.question_text: The first five multiples of 8 are:
Is 150 a multiple of 6?
questions.explanation_correct: 150 ÷ 6 = 25 (exact). So 150 is a multiple of 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 150 ÷ 6 = 25 with no remainder. Yes, it is a multiple of 6.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a prime number?
questions.explanation_correct: 23 has only two factors: 1 and 23. So it is prime. 15=3x5, 21=3x7, 27=3x9 are composite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 23 is divisible only by 1 and 23, making it prime.

questions.question_text: Is 1 a prime number?

options.text: No, it is neither prime nor composite

questions.explanation_correct: 1 has only one factor (itself). Prime numbers must have exactly 2 factors. So 1 is neither prime nor composite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1 is special: it has only one factor (1), so it is neither prime nor composite.

questions.question_text: Which is the smallest prime number?
questions.explanation_correct: 2 is the smallest prime number. It has exactly two factors: 1 and 2. (1 is not prime.)
questions.explanation_incorrect: 2 is the smallest and only even prime number.

questions.question_text: How many prime numbers are there between 10 and 20?
questions.explanation_correct: Primes between 10 and 20: 11, 13, 17, 19. That is 4 prime numbers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Check each: 11(prime), 12(no), 13(prime), 14(no), 15(no), 16(no), 17(prime), 18(no), 19(prime). Four primes.

questions.question_text: Is 456 divisible by 2?

options.text: Yes, because sum of digits is even

questions.explanation_correct: A number is divisible by 2 if its last digit is even. 456 ends in 6 (even), so it is divisible by 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Divisibility by 2: check last digit. 6 is even, so 456 is divisible by 2.

questions.question_text: Is 345 divisible by 3?
questions.explanation_correct: Sum of digits: 3+4+5=12. 12 is divisible by 3, so 345 is divisible by 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sum of digits = 12, which is divisible by 3. So 345 is divisible by 3.

questions.question_text: Is 785 divisible by 5?
questions.explanation_correct: A number is divisible by 5 if its last digit is 0 or 5. 785 ends in 5, so it is divisible by 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Last digit 5 means divisible by 5. 785 ÷ 5 = 157.

questions.question_text: Is 570 divisible by both 2 and 5?
questions.explanation_correct: 570 ends in 0, so it is divisible by both 2 and 5 (and hence by 10).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Last digit 0: divisible by 2, 5, and 10.

questions.question_text: Which number is divisible by both 3 and 5?
questions.explanation_correct: 45: last digit 5 (÷5 ok). Sum of digits=4+5=9 (÷3 ok). So 45 is divisible by both 3 and 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 45 ends in 5 (divisible by 5) and digit sum is 9 (divisible by 3).

questions.question_text: Every number is a factor of itself.
questions.explanation_correct: Any number divided by itself gives 1 (no remainder). So every number is a factor of itself.
questions.explanation_incorrect: n ÷ n = 1. So n is always a factor of n.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is composite?
questions.explanation_correct: 51 = 3 x 17, so it has more than 2 factors and is composite. 37, 41, 43 are all prime.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 51 = 3 x 17. It has factors 1, 3, 17, 51 — more than 2, so it is composite.

questions.question_text: The common multiples of 4 and 6 include:
questions.explanation_incorrect: Find multiples of both and identify common ones: 12, 24, 36...

questions.question_text: The common factors of 24 and 36 are:
questions.explanation_incorrect: List factors of both and find common ones: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12.

questions.question_text: The digit sum of 729 is ___. Is it divisible by 3?
questions.explanation_correct: 7+2+9=18. 18÷3=6. So 729 is divisible by 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sum: 7+2+9=18. Since 18 is divisible by 3, so is 729.

questions.question_text: How many factors does a prime number have?
questions.explanation_correct: A prime number has exactly 2 factors: 1 and itself.
questions.explanation_incorrect: By definition, a prime number has exactly 2 factors.

questions.question_text: The 10th multiple of 9 is:
questions.explanation_correct: 10th multiple of 9 = 9 x 10 = 90.

questions.question_text: Twin primes are pairs of primes that differ by 2. Which is a twin prime pair?
questions.explanation_correct: 11 and 13 are both prime and differ by 2. They form a twin prime pair.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both 11 and 13 are prime, and 13-11=2. This is a twin prime pair.

questions.question_text: A number ending in 0 is divisible by both 5 and 10.
questions.explanation_correct: If a number ends in 0, it satisfies the divisibility rules for both 5 (ends in 0 or 5) and 10 (ends in 0).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Last digit 0 means divisible by 5 and by 10.

questions.question_text: What is the largest factor of 100 other than 100 itself?
questions.explanation_correct: Factors of 100: 1,2,4,5,10,20,25,50,100. Largest other than 100 is 50.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 100÷2=50. So 50 is the largest factor besides 100 itself.

questions.question_text: Which is the only even prime number?
questions.explanation_correct: 2 is the only even prime. All other even numbers are divisible by 2 and have more than 2 factors.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 2 is the only even prime number. Every other even number is composite.

questions.question_text: Is 0 a multiple of every number?
questions.explanation_correct: Any number x 0 = 0. So 0 is a multiple of every number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: n x 0 = 0 for any n. So 0 is a multiple of every number.

questions.question_text: A number is divisible by 6 if it is divisible by:
questions.explanation_correct: 6 = 2 x 3. A number divisible by both 2 and 3 is divisible by 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Since 6 = 2 x 3, check divisibility by both 2 and 3.

questions.question_text: Find all factors of 48.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 48: 1x48, 2x24, 3x16, 4x12, 6x8. Ten factors in total.

questions.question_text: List all prime numbers between 1 and 20: ___
questions.explanation_correct: Primes from 1 to 20: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19 (8 primes).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Check each: 2,3,5,7 are prime. 11,13,17,19 are prime. Others are composite.

questions.question_text: Every multiple of 10 is also a multiple of 5.
questions.explanation_correct: 10 = 2 x 5, so every multiple of 10 is automatically a multiple of 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Since 10 is a multiple of 5, all multiples of 10 are also multiples of 5.

questions.question_text: Is 123 divisible by 3?
questions.explanation_correct: Sum of digits: 1+2+3=6. 6 is divisible by 3, so 123 is divisible by 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Digit sum = 6, divisible by 3. So 123 ÷ 3 = 41.

questions.question_text: Which number has exactly 3 factors?
questions.explanation_correct: 4 has factors: 1, 2, 4 (exactly 3). Numbers with exactly 3 factors are squares of primes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Factors of 4: 1, 2, 4. That is exactly 3 factors.

questions.question_text: What is the sum of the first 5 prime numbers?
Without dividing, tell if 8,430 is divisible by 2, 3, 5, and 10.
questions.explanation_correct: Last digit 0: divisible by 2, 5, 10. Digit sum: 8+4+3+0=15, divisible by 3. So all four.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ends in 0: ÷2, ÷5, ÷10. Digit sum 15: ÷3. Divisible by all four.

questions.question_text: What is the smallest common multiple of 3 and 5?
questions.explanation_correct: LCM of 3 and 5 = 15. Multiples of 3: 3,6,9,12,15. Multiples of 5: 5,10,15. First common: 15.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smallest number divisible by both 3 and 5 is 15.

questions.question_text: Is 7 a factor of 49?
questions.explanation_correct: 49 ÷ 7 = 7 exactly. So 7 is a factor of 49.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 49 = 7 x 7. Yes, 7 is a factor of 49.

questions.question_text: Which of these numbers is NOT composite?
questions.explanation_correct: 67 is prime (only factors: 1 and 67). 25=5x5, 57=3x19, 91=7x13 are composite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 67 has no factors other than 1 and 67. It is prime, not composite.

questions.question_text: The largest 2-digit number divisible by both 2 and 3 is ___
questions.explanation_correct: Must be divisible by 6. 96÷6=16. Check: ends in 6 (even), digit sum 9+6=15 (÷3). 96 is the answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Divisible by both 2 and 3 means divisible by 6. Largest 2-digit multiple of 6 = 96.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a multiple of 12?
questions.explanation_correct: 56 ÷ 12 = 4 remainder 8. So 56 is not a multiple of 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 36=12x3, 48=12x4, 72=12x6. But 56÷12 has a remainder, so 56 is not a multiple.

questions.question_text: A gardener has 60 plants. In how many equal rows can he arrange them?
questions.explanation_correct: The number of equal rows equals the factors of 60: 1,2,3,4,5,6,10,12,15,20,30,60.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each factor of 60 gives a possible number of equal rows.

questions.question_text: All even numbers greater than 2 are composite.
questions.explanation_correct: Every even number > 2 is divisible by 1, 2, and itself — at least 3 factors, making it composite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Even numbers > 2 have 2 as a factor (besides 1 and themselves), so they are composite.

questions.question_text: Is 999 divisible by 3?
questions.explanation_correct: Digit sum: 9+9+9=27. 27 is divisible by both 3 and 9. So 999 is divisible by both.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sum of digits = 27, divisible by 3 and 9. So 999 is divisible by both.

questions.question_text: The smallest multiple of any number (other than 0) is:
questions.explanation_correct: The smallest positive multiple of n is n itself (n x 1 = n).
questions.explanation_incorrect: n x 1 = n. The number itself is its smallest positive multiple.

questions.question_text: What are the common factors of 12 and 18?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Common factors of 12 and 18: 1, 2, 3, 6.

questions.question_text: A number between 30 and 40 that is prime is:
questions.explanation_correct: 31 is prime, 37 is prime. 32,33,34,35,36,38,39 are all composite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Between 30 and 40, only 31 and 37 are prime.

questions.question_text: Is 245 divisible by 5?
questions.explanation_correct: 245 ends in 5, so it is divisible by 5. 245 ÷ 5 = 49.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Last digit is 5, so divisible by 5.

questions.question_text: The number of factors of a prime number p is always:
questions.explanation_correct: Every prime number has exactly 2 factors: 1 and itself.
questions.explanation_incorrect: By definition, primes have exactly 2 factors.

questions.question_text: What is the 15th multiple of 6?
questions.explanation_correct: 15th multiple of 6 = 6 x 15 = 90.

questions.question_text: A number is divisible by 15 if it is divisible by:
questions.explanation_correct: 15 = 3 x 5. If a number is divisible by both 3 and 5, it is divisible by 15.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 15 = 3 x 5, so check divisibility by both 3 and 5.
